boardgame.name: Dust
Dust: Il gioco di strategia
Paolo Parente_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Dust
boardgame.description: Dust is a strategy board game of conquest and control. Seize power sources and capitals, develop your infrastructure, and build and wield vast, high-tech armies in your bid for global domination._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players will probably recognize the map as that of Earth, but what they will not see are any borders or nations. In the world of Dust, the unending war and the new technologies have altered the political face of Earth beyond all recognition._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;At the beginning of each turn, players select a card from their hand. This card represents their strategy for the coming turn and to a large extent dictates the actions a player can take._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;During their production phase, players spend production points to buy additional factories and units. Each individual unit type has its own unique statistics and effects, so players have to carefully consider the composition of their armies._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In combat, players alternate rolling dice and destroying units until one side has been eliminated (either due to casualties or retreats) or a cease-fire is declared._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;At the end of each game round, players score victory points for power sources, capitals, and majorities they control. The player who controls the most land areas earns bonus victory points, as does the player who controls the most sea areas and the player who controls the most production centers. The first player to amass a set number of victory points while also controlling a capital is the winner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Only once a player has amassed at least half the victory points required to win can he or she attack an enemy capital. Once the war has been so escalated, however, then all players are free to attack capitals._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Dust English Rules Premium Version _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;a target='_blank' href=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/ffg_content/Dust/Dust_Rulebook_Prem_Eng.pdf_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; rel=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;nofollow_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/ffg_content/Dust/Dust_Rule..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;/a_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Dust English Rules Epic Version _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;a target='_blank' href=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/ffg_content/Dust/Dust_Rulebook_Epic_Enig.pdf_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; rel=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;nofollow_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/ffg_content/Dust/Dust_Rule..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;/a_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Backstage _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;a target='_blank' href=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;http://www.kaleidosgames.com_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; rel=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;nofollow_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;http://www.kaleidosgames.com_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;/a_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Fantasy Flight Games (FFG DU01) In the year 1938, the scientific ship Schwabenland, its German flag flapping in the fierce, cold wind, approached the remote Arctic Circle on a secret mission. Even today, no one knows exactly what its original assignment was, but what it discovered dazed the entire world. Returning to its homeland, the Schwabenland brought back the relics of an alien starship and a member of its crew… still alive! While the world continued to fall down its chasm of global conflict, a select team of scientists covertly studied the potential military applications of the Antarctic discovery, but their secret would not last long. An underground war, parallel to the war in the open, was soon underway. Spies launched undercover operations, fighting to steal control and understanding of the alien technology. The brightest minds in the world pursued the new science, setting aside the research that might have led to atomic weapons. Before long, occultists and experts in ancient religions joined the scientists in their inquiries. These fringe thinkers came to believe that the new discoveries were somehow linked to the ancient tale of the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Vrill Kultur._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; This mythic, supposedly an advanced civilization, had disappeared into the ancient past as nimbly as a deer in the woods. The alien traveler soon shed more light on the theorists_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; studies. Vrill Kulture, they came to understand, was not a civilization, but a massively powerful energy source. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;VK,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; which could be mined only at certain locations around the globe, was so rare and precious that the alien had braved interstellar travel to claim it. By the time the locations of the VK deposits were discovered, and mining had begun, scientists had devised a multitude of ways to put it to use on the battlefield. The geographical distribution of the VK mines turned existing alliances and coalitions on their heads. The geopolitical balance of the entire planet stood on a knife edge. History has been re-written. Now, it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the dawn of a new era, with new strategies, new weapons, new armies. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the dawn of Dust.

Inside of game is new. The box lid of my copy is NOT like new. It has pieces of tape on three corners of the lid, where they were torn while lying upside down on the carpet. BUT YOU COULD NOT DO BETTER THAN THIS COPY OF DUST: The rest of the game is in perfect condition. I tested the board of my copy and it lies nice andflat, and the components are more than complete, as I ordered extra token markers and extra black pieces, so they can be used if you ever lose other colors. (Some pieces were missing in a lot of the copies of the original printing.) The cards are pristine. Also, I annotated the rulebook to fix all the problems I could research online, and included six color prints of the online reference sheet for card meanings. I think you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll appreciate my efforts. All my games are from a cat-free and smoke-free house. Feel free to package with any of my other games for sale, to save a little on shipping: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=viewuser_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;username=trader%20joe
